original: Årman, Karl Gustaf, prakt, läkare, Jönköping, f. 22/6/01 i Gustafs, Kop- parb. 1., av distr :förest. A. G. Ärman o. Maria Andersson. G. 3i7 m. fil. mag. Torborg Maria Gerdner. Barn: Torborg Anita f. 39, Tryggve 41, Birgit 43, Nils-Gustaf 45. — Stud:ex. i Sthlm 22, med. kand. 25 o. med. lic. 30 i Upps. Res. t. Tyiskl., Schweiz, Tjecko-sL, Österr. E. läk. v. Djursätra brunn’ 26-30, tif. assist :läk. v. Jönköp. las. 31, e. läk. v. med. avd. där 31-32 o. und:-läk. 32-34, tf. andre und :läk. v. Epid:-sjukh. i Sthlm 34, prakt. läk. i Jönköp. sed. 34, tf. stadisdistr :läk. där 36-39, läk. v. Epid:sjukh. 316-39, disp :läk. 37.
translated:
Årman, Karl Gustaf, civil servant, physician, Jönköping, born on June 22nd, 1901 in Gustafs, Kopparberg County, the first child of district manager A. G. Ärman and Maria Andersson. Married on March 17th, to Torborg Maria Gerdner, who holds a Bachelor of Philosophy degree. They have four children: Torborg Anita, born in 1939, Tryggve in 1941, Birgit in 1943, and Nils-Gustaf in 1945. 

Educational qualifications: Graduated from Stockholm Gymnasium in 1922, completed a Bachelor of Medicine degree in 1925, and obtained a Medical License in 1930 from Uppsala University. Traveled to Germany, Switzerland, Czechoslovakia, and Austria. Worked as a physician at Djursätra Sanatorium from 1926 to 1930, temporary assistant physician at Jönköping Hospital in 1931, medical department physician there from 1931 to 1932, and assistant physician from 1932 to 1934. Acted as temporary second assistant physician at the Epidemic Hospital in Stockholm in 1934. Practiced as a physician in Jönköping since 1934, temporarily serving as city district physician from 1936 to 1939. Worked as a physician at the Epidemic Hospital from 1936 to 1939 and as a dispensary physician in 1937.
